website_summaries.verdict: Huge coverage range and built-in compatibility with Amazon’s Alexa and Echo products may not make up for its bulky size.
pros: Compatible with Amazon's Alexa and Echo and offers web-based configuration along with its iOS or Android mobile app
cons: Some users don't like the units' large size

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUT READ MY COMMENTS CAREFULY
customer_reviews.text: Delivers blazing speeds and excellent coverage. The satellite integrated fairly easily into my existing ORBI network, but required a lot of dedication and some degree of expertise, to achieve stability*. (*this applies to the whole ORBI network as much as it does to this singular component) The ORBI users' community was much more supportive than the NETGEAR technical support, but when setting up the platform, there was little that was seamless. Remember that this particular item is a satellite product and does not function as a stand alone router.
customer_reviews.author: R. ALLAN

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to add to existing Orbi network
customer_reviews.text: Pressed the Sync buttons in the right order (new satellite first, router second) and it was up and running in less than five minutes. Perfect. Really easy. However.... One really important thing to note: When the new satellite first connects it'll probably go and grab the latest firmware, so it'll disappear from the network for a few minutes. I think it's this step that's confusing some people, and they end up pressing the sync button again or power cycling the satellite. Just wait for it to get the new firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ockenden

customer_reviews.title: Satellite speed quarter speed of router and you have to pay extra for Parental Controls!
customer_reviews.text: I literally get less than 50mbps when connected to the satellite, and up to 200mbps when connected to the router directly...sitting in the exact same location in the house! How can my phone connect to the router that much quicker than the satellite does! And there are no Parent controls on the devices that you don't have to pay for! Its $5.99 a month to use the parenting control that it was advertised as having!!! It is even missing a basic MAC address access scheduling tool! Who are these people writing all of these fantastic reviews on Amazon? I wish they'd learn how to evaluate tech gear to save my time buying rubbish like this.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: Don't add to an existing system
customer_reviews.text: The Orbi Mesh Network works extremely well. However if you later add a new satellite to an existing system with different (upgraded) firmware, the new satellite will fail when it starts to upgrade its firmware. This has happened twice to me with two different new satellites and cannot be a coincidence. The new unit will likely have older firmware and will "brick up" immediately after the attempted upgrade and not respond to the network as the firmware seems to get corrupted. It will not reset nor respond to the network. After wasting several hours trying to get it working, you'll simply return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant WiFi, TERRIBLE parental controls that you have to pay for!
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi is brilliant, but you are forced to pay £4.99 per month to have basic parental control! As if this was not enough, the parental controls have been broken from 30 May to time of writing with no ETA. I really cannot believe that NETGEAR have tried to turn basic controls into a profit generator then completely messed up a premium service. Sadly, I will never buy NETGEAR again as a result of their inept attempt to profiteer on basic router features.
customer_reviews.author: Nerosaki

customer_reviews.title: Buy Google WiFi instead
customer_reviews.text: Set up was no problem, the Wifi worked and speed was good, however even with the firmware updates, the WiFi would just drop, logs didn’t show any issues, in fact the logs showed no failure of broadband - this would happen quite often and no explaination- Put the old WiFi system back on and it worked with no drops for 48 hrs. Put the Netgear’s back on and it continued to drop. Can see on line issues with hardware with Netgear. Sent it back and purchased google WiFi and that has been rock solid. Easier to install better application software and solid performance. Get the Google WiFi instead
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shame really because this would be a great bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Had big issues with the fact you can’t separate the 5ghz band from 2.4ghz. Something on my network is slowing my 2.4ghz right down. I have to put the devices that need the speed onto the 5ghz band but with these you can’t do it. Shame really because this would be a great bit of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wifi network extender.
customer_reviews.text: I got this satellite to connect to an existing setup with one RBK50 and RBS50 satellite. The setup itself was simple, or rather would have been if I had simply followed the instructions in the box rather than try to add it via the Orbi iOS app. The app process didn’t work, but simply following the instructions and pressing the sync buttons worked flawlessly. And that’s despite the satellite having a different (older) firmware version than the existing setup, which some reviewers have alleged would brick it. Upgrading to the same firmware did require using logging in via a web browser, however, as the iOS app claimed there was no update to install.
customer_reviews.author: MJI

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: At last, a brilliant mesh system with Cat6 backhaul. Our WiFi speeds on our iOS devices have gone from 23Mbps to 280Mbps on the edge of the network. The only fault I have been able to find is the Netgear Armour app (awful, do not enable unless you are paranoid) and if you have multiple networks operating indoors (hardwire and WiFi split) then setup can be a bit of headache as the setup wizard is good if you want the Orbi to be at the top of the network, telling it’s not allowed on the 192.168.1.x range is something our Orbi through a complete hissy fit about. Otherwise, for WiFi, really good product.
customer_reviews.author: mrStat

customer_reviews.title: Orbi with Virgin
customer_reviews.text: I had a very flaky WiFi connection in my house with Virgin's Hub 3. A better solution is a mash Wifi Network which covers all parts of my house which isn't really big but as many neighbouring WiFi networks. Orbi seems to be a good solution. Firstly, I installed the Orbi router as a AP downstairs and the Satellite upstairs. Virgin router really doesn't like this and had intermittenet connection problems. The solution is to use Orbi as only router and set Virgin's router to modem mode. Now it seems to work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Kern

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it says
customer_reviews.text: Having debated buying this due to the cost, but also the desire to have a new solution thanks to the awful Virgin Media Superhub 3 I finally took the plunge. Setup with relative ease although some slight teething issue caused by modem mode on the hub 3 but a restart and we were away. Great performance and great looking. I love the size and design. I now can feel the benefit of my 500mbs fibre and on average have a connection throughout my whole house and garden of 350mbs. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make the most of your Wifi
customer_reviews.text: These make the most of the available broadband in our home. We turned off the Wifi signal from our router and plugged in the base station and now use that WiFi instead. We now get the full speed in every part of the home. We no longer have to sit next to the router to get a good signal. It cured the "Not Spots" in our home. Setup was straight forward. There's lots of setup options on the Web Portal and the App works well. Having ethernet ports on each device helped connect devices like the AV Receiver which does not have WiFi. It's expensive, but really good.
customer_reviews.author: K PORTER

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and underperforming
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely expensive product with a very poor performance in real life First of all the settings doesn't let you choose WIFI bands as normal. You have to have both 2.4 and 5Mhz . The speed tests were showing worse than my old 3 year old sky router and the range is even worse with additional of a satellite!? I had in the end someone from IT from work coming to re install it as I thought I was doing something wrong but he confirmed that the orbit is just a fancy overpriced modem and extender , that's all. Have changed now to a better router that cost half the price but outperforms both in range and speed.
customer_reviews.author: N. Nubelus

customer_reviews.title: The most expensive piece of crap I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Mesh Wi-Fi System as the signal in the room where I work is really week and the reviews were so good. Really, avoid to waste your money. The signal is much stronger indeed, however, I lost the signal constantly wich is very annoying. I tried to use a ethernet cable and is even worse because a lost the signal even more frequently. Now I have to save to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeronimo G.

customer_reviews.title: Had high expectations, no disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Had a cheaper mesh network system which worked well for basic browsing and light traffic, but with three youngsters, my gaming habits and my wife doing her Netflix activity the old system was showing strain. Never got more than 70Mb/s on individual devices despite 350Mb/s speed from ISP. Netgear Orbi was dead easy to set up and works brilliantly. Access on my mobile is now at least 250Mb/s downstairs where the Orbi devices are, and at least 150 upstairs. Very consistent and no complaints from the small humans, just delighted by the "amazing ping". Job done.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gowen

customer_reviews.title: A breath of fresh air to our network
customer_reviews.text: We've got a wired network all around the house but of course most devices these days are not so WiFi that works is a must. The BT supplied router for our FTTP line was useless and kept dropping devices and it's connection to the fibre node. We can plug this Orbi setup immediately in to the fibre node and don't need to use any other boxes. It set itself up in mere minutes and by using the same SSID as before everything just perked up and worked as expected within a few more minutes. Only a couple of downtimes since we have it and I think that may have been firmware update related.
customer_reviews.author: Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Good mesh system
customer_reviews.text: I changed from a router and wifi extender to a "mesh" system as I was fed up of having different SSID's and weak spots around the house This system is good as it uses one SSID (although devices don't always pick the closest unit) and it lacks some of the features that my old Linksys router had around content filtering / device control but the benefits and simplicity (and improved speed) far outweigh the negatives. I'm probably going to get another satellite at some point to improve the signal in my garage and garden - the good thing with that is, it's very easy to expand this sytem if needed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Webster

customer_reviews.title: You will need 1 sataliite per floor
customer_reviews.text: Loving the difference this makes compaired to my old virgin router, much stronger signal around my house, and much less issues with devices looding connection. I would say that the 5000 sq feet coverage is a bit of a deam considering most people's houses are split in to floors it would likely be much less coverage unless you live in an open plan warehouse! So ideally you need one satellite per floor for best results. The aldo item looks nice too on the side. Very happy with my purchase its expensive but solved a lot of issues I was having with Virgins equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Mileslt

customer_reviews.title: this product has transformed my Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to Set up and I had it working within about 30 minutes. I really like the analytics app that tells you what is happening with the mesh system and who is connected to which router. Compared to other mesh systems on the market, This feels like a expensive product but I bought it because there were so many consistently good reviews and I have no Complaints whatsoever As my previous system which had lots of Wi-Fi extenders was unreliable and since the moment my Orbi started working I have had no signal drop-offs.
customer_reviews.author: eagle dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Awful Tech support, and issues with setup,
customer_reviews.text: This item has very poor tech support and does not meet the stated distances, also has very poor indicators for issues as the lights do not do what they are supposed to half the time. the installation and setup manual are not tried and tested as they do not match what should happen and tech support contradict many of the setup methods
customer_reviews.author: Harish

customer_reviews.title: Why haven't you upgraded yet?
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Just wow! I purchased this to replace my current home network which consisted of a gateway, WiFi router, WiFi access point, high gain ariels etc. At some points in the house I'd get between 1 & 3MB WiFi connection. Replacing all the previous kit with the Orbi, I'm now seeing a 75MB WiFi connection where it was single figures previously. Very impressive. And coupled with the built in Circle functionality, this has to be a must buy for any home with kids so you can not only filter the content they view online but also limit the amount of time they can access the net. Brilliant. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Dave W

customer_reviews.title: Orbital Orbi
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic solution to home wifi black spots. Although expensive, really does solve those weak signal issues. I found the initial set up was successful but I wasn't entirely satisfied. I resolved the issue by logging into the router home page and running the set up again. This established the correct modem router connection (in my case the Netgear Nighthawk) and configured the Orbi router to operate with the satellite with more stability. Since the reconfiguration the Orbi has operated flawlessly, offering superb wifi both inside and outside the house.
customer_reviews.author: Tinmachine

customer_reviews.title: to replace my Virgin Media Super Hub router and Netgear wi-fi extender combination
customer_reviews.text: Impressed by online reviews, and the recommendation of an acquaintance, I decided to invest in an RBK50 router + single satellite combination, to replace my Virgin Media Super Hub router and Netgear wi-fi extender combination. (We kept on losing signal in various rooms). Installation was dramatically easy and it's also very easy to manage the network through the web admin interface. The associated iOS ORBI app is pretty good too. We no longer have "not-spots" in our house, and everyone's happy. Hardly a cheap product but it certainly delivers.
customer_reviews.author: TonyF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bit of kit! Stuck my Virgin Media Superhub in Modem modem, plugged the router and satellites in and was up and running in no time. Super fast broadband over all three floors of my house and even managed to retire my powerline plugs as I get fast WiFi in the gym at the bottom of my garden. Outstanding bit of kit highly recommended. Only issue was pairing one of my Ring cameras, but reading the forum I set the 2.4Ghz band to 6 and it works. The Netgear Genie app adds a lot of extra functionality if you want to dig a little deeper into the settings. Seems pretty good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Indeed not the cheapest, most of us have checked out and evaluated the options. So why Orbi RBK50 (main + 1 satellite)? It douse what it says on the tin, easy, FAST (yes anywhere in my 2 story house I get minimum 100Mb), nice android app and the configuration is very straight forward. I was a bit reluctant as the set I decided for only had one satellite vs the competition but I was proven wrong :)
customer_reviews.author: Per

customer_reviews.title: SmartTV connected but no content streaming
customer_reviews.text: SmartTV NOT connecting. Internet showing connected on the TV..... All other devices working perfectly!!! Go to the Orbi router directly with a web browser NOT through the Orbi app. Look for ‘Attached Devices’ when your tv is on... look for your tv’s name - on wired or wireless connection- then change the pull down menu icon to ‘Media Streamer’ NOT ‘TV’ which is the default. Turn tv off/on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worth the over priced price tag
customer_reviews.text: We have had the NETGEAR RBK50 Router and Satellite system, plus an extra satellite (later addition), running as an access point in our office for since 3 Mar 2017. The office is around 3000sq feet and over two floors. The office building is old (1850), mostly open plan with a couple of smaller rooms, a kitchen and a larger meeting space and since adding an extra satellite, we haven't had any problems with signal strength, or dropout. I've been pleased with the system, although I do feel that the £500 setup (Router and Satellite system, plus an extra satellite) is pretty steep.​
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for WiFi around the home plus plug anywhere Ethernet connection
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says.Wifi signal around my house improved. Didnt have WiFi upstairs before but after using this now I do. I also bought this to add an Ethernet connection in the study and it worked a treat after some patience setting it up. My WiFi speed has not degraded which was important and connection to websites was quicker. Just remember your download speeds won’t improve with this as it doesn’t increase your broadband speed.
customer_reviews.author: Hui Ying Chiu

customer_reviews.title: The best WiFi I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: After constant frustration from Sky Q, I’m finally happy with the WiFi in my home! I have the router (in AP mode) connected to my Sky Q router (and have disabled WiFi on that and the minis) and I have the satellite upstairs connected to a 24 port gigabit switch (I hardwired the house, every room has a socket that then goes into another 8 port switch). I run all my Sky Q and Plex devices hardwired but use WiFi for mobiles and tablets, laptops, ring doorbell and cameras, Fitbit scales, printers, several Amazon Echos and I get a great signal and high speeds throughout my home (and garden which is a bonus!).
customer_reviews.author: Chris Newman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mesh WiFi in conjunction with Virgin Media Hub 3.0
customer_reviews.text: I have the Orbi connected to Virgin Media Hub 3.0 in router mode and the WiFi signal and speeds are fantastic. I had an inferior budget mesh WiFi system for a few weeks that didn’t work well. I upgraded to Netgear and I’m not disappointed. To enhance my network I have also put in a Sonos Boost to ensure my 7 Sonos speakers aren’t compromising my WiFi. My ISP provide me with 350mbps, and I’m getting that delivered to me and the Orbi is not compromising that at all. The app that comes with the Orbi is very easy to use and the workflow on it is simple. This includes the initial setup.
customer_reviews.author: Tim james

customer_reviews.title: Amazing WiFi Improvement - It works really well.
customer_reviews.text: Connected to a Plusnet Router in 'Access Point' (AP) mode. Installation is fairly self explanatory but a bit fiddly and once the devices had connected according to instructions, I set the Orbi into AP mode manually and then switched off the Plusnet routers wifi. I now have a very strong wifi signal throughout the house (almost full bandwidth in every corner) which is pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, had tried several WiFi extenders however they did not live up to expectations in speed or connectivity. WiFi endpoints hold onto a signal no matter how bad and won’t switch over until it can no longer connect.... this made WiFi extenders very difficult to use. A mesh system manages the handover much better.... I decided to use Ethernet backhaul to connect these two orbi routers - this has allowed me to place them further apart while keeping the top speeds of my service provider all over the house and into the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: Mesh Network - way better than an extender
customer_reviews.text: This product promises a lot, and generally delivers. I have managed to get it working after wrestling with the setup process. I replace my BT Home Hub 5 with this and a Netgear modem, but could not (for some reason) get a connection outbound to the internet, even though the Orbi app said there was a good internet connection. Wi-fi coverage is much better in my home (quite large), and there appear to be no issues yet. Still early days, but seemingly a good product.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage and speed
customer_reviews.text: Set this up with my virgin Media Home Hub 3 and initially it was a pain as the device didn't like me setting the Virgin box in Modem mode. No need just turn the Wireless signal off and all is hunky dory. If you call your Orbis the same name as your exsisting wireless lan then you will save yourself time on reconfiguring the wifi settings of the numerous wifi devices we have in the home nowadays
customer_reviews.author: E. R. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Really simple setup...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product with very easy support. Only thing I would say is make sure you don’t underestimate the number of satellites, wishing I’d bough the model with 2 satellites... just to make coverage even better. Ohhh and external one on top as well just to go mad and cover back garden... Just bear in mind you still need a modem... it’s not included and easy to miss.
customer_reviews.author: FERGUS MCARTHUR

customer_reviews.title: Had some issues with Sonos
customer_reviews.text: While the rest of my Sonos speakers work fine, the Sonos 1s I bought recently don't play great. Seems that I need a wired connection to keep them all online which is a little annoying. I tried to disable the “Enable WMM (Wi-Fi multimedia) settings” setting which worked but this dropped my network speed from 300Mbps to 20, not great. Reenabling and plugging a speaker into the main router seems to the only setting that works.
customer_reviews.author: Maxieduncan

customer_reviews.title: Good value, works well.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased during the black Friday sales at a great price, Eventually got around adding this satellite onto my existing system and after a bit of faffing around (used the mobile app) trying to sync, i lost both satellites then after about five minutes and a couple of resets on the new satellite it all came back on and the new sat had updated its firmware to match the originals.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Good spread of internet signal
customer_reviews.text: Though the internet signal is broadly shared but sometimes, signal gets dropped frequently. I had to send for a replacement, which appears to be better in performance but sometimes, still drops signal.
customer_reviews.author: Nir15

customer_reviews.title: Loads of Advertisements But Falls Short of Expectations
customer_reviews.text: So If the router are close to each other then it says Backhaul status GOOD - If you move them up and to another room then it becomes POOR! It should be called a Wifi Mess network and Not a Mesh network! Whats the point - If you buy something rated for 4000Sft and mine is only 3000 Sft and it still does not do the job! More Slower than the old WIfi Extender it replaced currently not happy at all with it. I am going to do another factory reset before I throw it back to Netgear!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: RBK53 whole house coverage
customer_reviews.text: RBK53 whole house coverage By Keith Kennedy 12345 I went for the RBK53 to get best coverage.Now have great fast wifi all over the house.In addition to better wifi coverage you can speed up devices with older wireless cards and an RJ45 port.For example a couple of old laptops that were taking an age to backup over wifi due to their older wifi standards.Connected them to one of the satellites RJ45 ports and was able to get faster backups due to the tri-band system.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive results bit of a pain to initially setup
customer_reviews.text: Pain to set up as initially the pods were also trying to download and update the firmware. However, once up and running the performance is magical. I bought these over other similar products as I wanted the hard wired outputs and I will reconfigure the boxes to be connected by a Cat 6 Cable rather than rely on the WiFi connection. I’ve an app on the Android phone and did before and after measurements. The results showed a spectacular improvement, whether in the loft or in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Simple and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my virgin hub as I was getting a really unreliable Wi-Fi signal through the house, constantly disconnecting and very slow speeds. The Orbi mesh (I just needed one satellite) has given me a strong stable fast connection in every room in the house with speeds that far exceed the virgin router speeds. Very easy to set up and connected to all my smart home devices (echos, nest thermostats camera and protects, airplay speakers) and three computers without any problems. The whole thing took less than ten minutes to get up and running. Great device and it looks nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Andy L

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup brilliant coverage
customer_reviews.text: Having a very long bungalow with the suppliers router in the rear of the house WiFi coverage even with a boaster was sketchy just past the middle of the property. Having no technical knowledge I took the plunge and brought the Orbi....easy setup all done by an app on the phone. Total coverage of the whole place, no buffering even with 14 devices connected. Really pleased with this 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Marky

customer_reviews.title: A great product after the firmware update
customer_reviews.text: I have initially decided to return the item due to unstable connection with iOS devices. I am now keeping it and is a very happy user. After the latest update of firmware in Sep/Nov, the router is now fast (quick faster than my old Airport extreme due to much wider coverage of signal through the dedicated backhaul) and stable. As long as Netgear is willing to invest resources to provide good software to support the excellent hardware - this will continue to be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: GN

customer_reviews.title: WiFi sorted....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Orbi system after reading many positive reviews from other users. I had tried many different routers and extenders being positioned at various points around my modist dwelling to no avail. However, although it is early days with the Orbi it is working well coverage and speed has improved drastically in every room in the house. Finally the biggest spin off is it has stopped my other half from moaning about internet and poor WIFI performance...
customer_reviews.author: Sharkfin

customer_reviews.title: Had numerous problems
customer_reviews.text: Had numerous problems installing the system. We need a stable and fast system. Whilst this system seemed fast, it was not very stable. I had real problems setting connecting the satellites. Once all set up the router would stop working after a couple of days. I had to re-set the system up a number of times, including changing many settings after investigating other people having similar problems.. In the end we had enough and have replaced the system with TPLink Deco, which was easier to set up and although a little slower on paper it isn't noticeable. What we have noticed is TPLink is much more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: worth the money in the end
customer_reviews.text: Had this product a while now - started off ok but software/firmware updates soon caused problems. Its been hit and miss until you are lucky enough to get a properly tried and tested version update. I received this a few weeks ago and now its great again. Got there in the end!! (my no nonsense review)
customer_reviews.author: Pro1

customer_reviews.title: Huge speed boost over wider area
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed. The product came within some nice boxing and easy to read instructions. Plugged the BT router into the new Orbi, switched off the old wifi network, switched on the Orbi and the app did the configuring by itself. What really surprised was speed i had in the back room, over 50mbs whilst before through an extender managed at best 8mbs. I can now happily avoid video buffering around the house which is brilliant. A bonus of course is the wifi stays on a single network id, meaning no switching to a different wifi network.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: My wifi disconnects are now fixed !
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install (not sure why people say the Google one has an easier set-up, it could not be easier with the Netgear app) but importantly, no more wifi glitches from the VirginMedia router that insisted on stopping the signal altogether for no reason twice a day or more. It also maintains very well the incoming bandwidth. I got another satellite for full coverage of our house as the range is somewhat limited. It is pricey but worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Le Grand Meaulnes

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to have a little trouble setting it up as it just kept going in circles saying it was a new set up from scratch...then once complete it started the process again....that said once it finally worked after an hour of messing it’s amazing...solid 100-200meg WiFi throughout the house and fingers cross Alexia has not once dropped out or randomly disconnected as of yet!....expensive for sure but looks like it’s worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Tony B.

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Virgin SuperHub 3 router upstairs but reception downstairs was always hit and miss. So I even had Ethernet run to downstairs as it used to be the only way to get something usable. After I bought an Orbi system I have switched SuperHub to modem-only mode and put the main Orbi station next to it and a satellite downstair connected via Ethernet (not exactly standard way but worked perfectly). Now we can use WiFi upstairs, downstairs and in the garden completely transparent.
customer_reviews.author: SergueiTheMeerkat

customer_reviews.title: So far great performance
customer_reviews.text: I have WiFi on all 3 floors in my house on full power. I used Cat 6a 15m cables to retain 1GBPS internal lan speeds across all my wired devices. So far everything works like a charm. :) The web access to the routers could have more options but as long as everything works its pretty simple and easy to use and install.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardas

customer_reviews.title: I expected better given the numerous great reviews
customer_reviews.text: Coverage was not that great and no better than my BT whole home mesh it was replacing. I liked that it had a backhaul advantage over Google's Nest Wifi but in the end I returned it and am happier with the range and stability of the Google product. I live in a small brick built 1930's semi so didn't expect the Orbi to struggle pushing out into my garden. Oh well, sorry Netgear but you didnt impress me.
customer_reviews.author: victorb

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful product, dreadful support
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours trying to configure this wifi mesh router to work with my Plusnet router/modem. After several hours of my time and then an hour and a half on the phone to Netgear's tech support they still couldn't get it to work. There is nothing special about my modem and this should have been really simple to set up. The lady on Netgear's technical help line had very limited technical knowledge and every step of the way she had to put me on hold to "talk to her manager". Amazon were brilliant in the ease of return and refund (thank you Amazon) but I will never by a Netgear product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want to cover large house with fast Wifi
customer_reviews.text: Relatively slow speeds on short range. Excellent long-range speeds. Drops connections quite often, especially if units are closer than approx. 15m from each other. This was fixed to some degree by firmware updates. Routers are relatively high. Setup is easy, but advanced users will find it very simple and limiting in configuration. Expensive. Overall - a good home solution if you are after relatively fast device with easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Matt

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a result of a Which report. It is excellent. Finally all my 'net problems are solved. Getting over 350mbps both downstairs and upstairs when my previous brand could not even manage the next room with only open glass French doors separating the router and satellite! It is such a relief to have an item like this that works.
customer_reviews.author: Knitman

customer_reviews.title: Orbi RBK50 home installation  By Les Campbell on Jan 1, 2018 9:37:57 PM
customer_reviews.text: Orbi RBK50 home installation By Les Campbell on Jan 1, 2018 9:37:57 PM  I found the installation very easy connected the modem and satellite as per instructions. They paired and set up quickly. The registration process works best using a PC rather than a Mac. Once the app was downloaded adding devices was quick and simple, checking the speed of the wireless I was achieving excellent results the same as a wired connection. Having just one logon means that I can move around my home with no dead spots or signal loss. A great investment that has given high quality wireless across all devices with no loss of signal or speed
customer_reviews.author: Golf18

customer_reviews.title: Amazing WiFi signal
customer_reviews.text: Was previously using top-end powerline adapters but was finding they couldn't provide the full bandwidth of my fibre connection around the house, topping out at around ~150 mbp/s even with the 1.2Gbp/s adapters. This on the other hand, with a single satellite? My Xbox upstairs can down download over my fibre connection so fast it literally soaks all the bandwidth the drops the Netflix quality downstairs without applying some bandwidth settings of the router. So, yeah, this thing does it' job alright. Best, most consistent WiFi connection I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. M. Westlake

customer_reviews.title: Brick walls cause major coverage issues
customer_reviews.text: When connected between the router and satellite the system is excellent. However, the distance covered is very different when your house is built with brick walls, my house has a total area of 400 sqm (single story) I can only get coverage with this system reliably in half of the house. The bedroom area that has 2 walls between the room and the router and distance of 20 meters (direct) is a complete dead spot, even the satellite at 1 wall and 10 meters can not get there, so I still have to run a network cable to get coverage in the bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Not intuitive to setup but great when it's up and running.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the RBS50 to add to an existing Orbi network that I'd installed and set up previously. Adding the satellite to the existing system wasn't intuitive. It took several attempts over the course of 30 minutes using the Orbi app before it finally connected. Since connecting it's been terrific. Speeds are fantastic and the signal strength is stable. I think another reviewer indicated that it may need to automatically update once it's plugged in and on the network? I'm not sure exactly why it didn't connect easily the first 8 or 9 times I tried but am glad that it's now up and running and I'm very happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Allan - Stirling

customer_reviews.title: Simple large area coverage
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple to install, the satellite was configured right out the box, and the app makes changing the settings a doddle. My only gripe is that there are a few things like manual port forwarding and static ip-mac binding that can’t be done on this router. It’s also quite expensive, and the additional satellites are individually expensive too, meaning that future expansion is unlikely to be economically viable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W

customer_reviews.title: It's...OK
customer_reviews.text: I went for the three Orbi config as that best suited my house shape and it's OK. Maybe i was hoping for a little too much after reading the description but in all honesty, it isn't much stranger than the Sky router and extender I had in already. There is a little (3-5M) further reach, which is helpful but it is glitchy and can drop from time to time. This was an expensive solution and I haven't managed to justify the cost.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Best Home WiFi, ever!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant! I replaced my WiFi power line extenders for this mesh system, and now I have a single password, no deadspots, and fast WiFi everywhere. The Disney Circle is great too, if you have kids. I have total control, can block apps like YouTube and musical.ly at device level, and can pause the entire Internet at the touch of a button on my phone if the kids aren’t listening! I didn’t rate tech support because I haven’t needed to use it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Stuart

customer_reviews.title: its B---Y difficult to connect to wi fi!!!
customer_reviews.text: the reviews said it was easy to set up as far as the wifi network itself is concerned , thats true . but what they didn't mention was that it won't connect to the internet through the hub . its taken me 3 days of researching and discussing with vodafone and its still not connected!! grrr! still no contact from netgear about it. and it was expensive!!!
customer_reviews.author: brian leslie elvy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant wifi signal all over the house
customer_reviews.text: I have a big enough house and we had a good enough router but the wifi signal upstairs was awful. I did a bit of research and decided on the Netgear Orbi. I had it setup within 30 minutes using a PC rather than the App. Signal all over the house is now great with great bandwidth. I also run a lot of appliances off it (Sky, Smart TVs, Chromecase, NAS) and everything is working brilliantly. The app is a great little tool to see all of the connections and change things like the wifi name and password.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really impressive
customer_reviews.text: As a general rule I've always been disappointed with WiFi speeds and never found it reliable for large file transfer etc. But I've just put in Netgear's Orbi mesh wifi with two nodes. First test was to see if I could hit the limits of the Internet connection, and that passed with flying colors. Then I connected my HTPC to one of the GigE ports on the node and tested a large file transfer, it hit 70+MB/s to my desktop which is damn impressive. Particularly impressive as the node is in a room that was built as an extension so the wall between the room and the rest of the house is solid brick.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Shame really because this would be a great bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Had big issues with the fact you can’t separate the 5ghz band from 2.4ghz. Something on my network is slowing my 2.4ghz right down. I have to put the devices that need the speed onto the 5ghz band but with these you can’t do it. Shame really because this would be a great bit of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Product - I switched from Apple's Airport to Orbi and very happy with my choice
customer_reviews.text: I had an Apple AirPort Extreme and swore by it. I thought nothing could be better but I bought the NETGEAR Orbi Tri-band Whole Home Mesh Wi-Fi System with 3Gbps Speed (RBK50) - Router & Extender and wow it is miles better than I expected. Firstly it was very easy to set up. Secondly the range and stability is better and I will never regret my decision. As an Apple fan, I can tell you it was a hard decision to make but a brilliant one. Fully recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlhr

customer_reviews.title: Does the job just great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to create an office in my home along with a couple of desks, three non wifi computers, printers etc, but had not network cabling from the incoming router to this area. I wasn't sure if such a product existed, but the satellite has four sockets of its own so not only does it extend the wifi, but allows these computers and printer to plug directly into the network. The speed is as good as the main router and apart from some niggles that their tech line helped with its been great!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Be patient
customer_reviews.text: After seeing a number of negative reviews i was worried about purchasing. I followed instruction and thought it was going to be a nightmare. however once i updated the firm ware and waited a while it all seems to work well, be patient. The app works great and have very happy kids with stable Wifi in all rooms. Great for my office and guests. Covers all dead spots in the house and even works outside now.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Butler

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: Really very pleased with our Orbi. We always thought it was our internet playing up but in actual fact our Virgin router just wasn’t great at dispersing the WiFi. Since installation we can now get WiFi in our garden and on the top floor of the house. We purchased this on our friend’s recommendation and we definitely do not regret our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: schlaus

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my Apple Airport system as I could net get the range I wanted. It has proven faster than the Airport and I will be adding to it to extend the range further. The units are a little larger than I would have liked, so make sure you have room to place them.
customer_reviews.author: Westwoodman

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid wifi mesh network
customer_reviews.text: Brought these to replace my crappy BT home Wifi units. After much research I decided to purchase the Orbi. I’ve had them for around a month and they have not dropped signal or crashed like the BT ones. Network speeds have been very good and most importantly it’s been providing a strong and reliable network. The range is surprisingly good, was sceptical about going from 3 units to 2 but these provide much better coverage. Overall very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Winst

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for our house
customer_reviews.text: Our house has thick concrete floors so we've struggled with dead wifi spots. Previous extenders have not worked well because as soon as anyone went on Youtube the internet access through them diminished. Orbi has been a game changer in our house, the mesh technology is great as no need to keep connecting to different extenders from room to room/different sections of the house. No performance issues if anyone is streaming. Although on the pricey side I would definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Natalieml

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Have the router and one satellite and that covers by 3 bed semi and out building with ease. Fast data transfer over wifi and good coverage. Easy to setup especially if you are used to Netgear products. The app is ok but could do with some work to make it a bit faster and fix notification issues
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Howitt

customer_reviews.title: get the most out of your Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: It's a fantastic product if you have Wi-Fi blind spots my Wi-Fi speeds at the back end of the house is the same or 10-15%less the Wi-Fi speeds in the sitting room in the front of the house where the Wi-Fi router is and the tower is at the back of the house.... I have a 200mb broadband and I used to get 30 megabytes at the back of the house now I get 180 to 190mb constantly
customer_reviews.author: Badrobot

customer_reviews.title: RBK50 - easy setup on BT and fantastic performance.
customer_reviews.text: Just set this up yesterday ( tip - use the webpage orbilogin for setup) and it was a treat to setup. The router is downstairs hooked into my BT Homehub in Router mode; the satellite is upstairs. WiFi is now excellent across the whole house and the whole system is easy to manage via the Orbi app on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Not quite there
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says on the tin. Sort of, it has almost no advanced features and have no QoS on devices that are hardwired. Lots of settings that are basic on cheap routers are not available with this system. It’s more plug and play, but for the money, you’d expect more. Probably would consider the Google Mesh next time. I’ve got a switch plugged into the main orbi router. And the QoS doesn’t work at all. If they updated their software to add features, it could be great.
customer_reviews.author: Inmate Rich

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I started having problems with WiFi dropping off, which had not been a problem for a long time using the ASUS RT-N66U. I tested the BT line via ethernet and it was always good. I decided the only thing it could be was my ASUS causing the problem, maybe due to more devices using it and neighbours wifi interfering? So I bought the Netgear RBK50 (Router and Satellite) and all I can say very impressed, easy to set up, the mobile app is excellent and most importantly the WiFi does not drop off and as a bonus I can get it at the end of my Garden.
customer_reviews.author: G Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. After what felt like decades deciding which mesh WiFi system to get, I obviously decided on this one. I don’t regret it at all, the entire house is covered in strong WiFi which never drops and I never have issues with. The app is simple which is ideal. I was considering connecting the satellite to the router via Ethernet or powerline, but the dedicated second 5ghz backhaul band has a strong connection and there is no difference when running speed tests whether I’m connected to the main router or attached satellite. 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Beresford

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use instead of virgin media SH2. Put the superhub into modem mode and then installed the Orbi. Installation was easy using the mobile app except that the router would not find the satellite unless it was next to it. Once the router had updated its firmware I moved the satellite to the other side of the house and it worked fine. Since installation no drop outs and my WiFi speed is 220 mbs which is my max available. I am hoping the router side is more stable than the SH2 but only time will tell. Of note I tried an Asus router prior to this but the WiFi wouldn’t reach the whole house. The Orbi signal gets everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Forster

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS DREADFUL - DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Utter crap. Honestly, I am a very tech savvy person - yes, the setup is pretty straight forward, but the range is appalling. I have ended up having to have the base station within 20 feet of the satellite (with no walls in between) and even then, the signal constantly drops out. I have ended up having to lay physical cables between the satellites and the base unit because it is so terrible - kind of defeats the object right?! I may as well have just spent a few quid on cables than bothering with this utter rubbish. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY FOLKS...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great range
customer_reviews.text: I built a home office shed in the garden - it's about 30 metres away from the satellite router in my living room, albeit with no obstructions except for glass. The signal is strong enough to reliably reach the shed, with enough bandwidth to stream 4k netflix. Really impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as made out in other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Having just purchased and installed this, I have come to realise it is not as good as what I was expecting. I am still getting black spots in rooms which are only 15 metres away.. Even 5 metres away I notice that 4 bars of Wifi drops to 2. This is similar to what I was getting with my existing router and so there is no improvement. The improvement i do find is with the satellite device upstairs which gives me better download speeds than my old extender, but the distance that this extends to has not improved. Not really worth the money paid out.
customer_reviews.author: N. McGeoch

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and good coverage
customer_reviews.text: The units were very easy to install & configure thanks to the app, which definitely takes the pain out of networks. They deliver good coverage and excellent speed. We now have no blackspots in the house and we're receiving the full 200mb our cable provide provides without any problems
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Price

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product - I have spent a fortune on other ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product - I have spent a fortune on other solutions to improve my wifi coverage across my house which is over 6000 sq foot. Was relatively straightforward to setup and delighted with the coverage and wifi speed. I also purchased an additional satellite to give me coverage to the garden which is now up and running and working well. Would highly recommend, best solution out of the multiple ones I have tried over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Alan P.

customer_reviews.title: Worst mesh product
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews. But this is really bad that I had to let the public know. Simply put don't buy it. You will.be ok for a month. The problem.starts where your vigin router has internet and Orbi shows it does and plays as nothing wrong..but no I ternet connected..it shows when you try to check the speed of internet from orbi App. Its boxed and ready to go back. Invested on Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Cham

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Fast to set up but beware of updating firmware it can brick this orbi and it happened to me. Second one I did not bother updating firmware and has been rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic performance, easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I've struggled with wifi signal for years using a BT home hub and a variety of extenders. I thought this was expensive but it had strong endorsement, so I decided to start over and purchased along with a basic router. It worked first time, out the box. Wifi speeds are strong, latency low, and no dark spots anywhere in the house. I also like the ability to limit wifi by device for errant children using devices at night! A well deserved 5/5
customer_reviews.author: @stillrustic

customer_reviews.title: Great wi-fi range and works well with Sky Q setup
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Orbi Router(RBR50) & satellite and have been thoroughly impressed with how much it has improved and extended our wi-fi. I managed to get it working alongside our Sky Q setup, each system running on different channels without issue. I now get a strong signal throughout the house, even down to the summerhouse over 30m at the bottom of the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Mann

customer_reviews.title: Great for consistent wifi across home
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before opting to spend this much to improve my WiFi but so glad I did! Now got consistent fast WiFi across the house. Connected the base unit to our broadband router (which you need to turn off the router WiFi so you only use the Netgear Orbi Wifi), and then followed set up, and within 5 minutes was up and running. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L

customer_reviews.title: Great solution
customer_reviews.text: The Netgear Orbi works perfectly for me, the kit is probably slightly overkill for my size of house but covers my whole garden and future proofs me for a future move. Really works as a 2-in-1 solution for me, firstly as a great WiFi solution but also has allowed me to replace my powerline adaptors and use the network switch on the satellite to connect my nas and desktop computer. Couldn't recommend the system highly enough, really easy to set up, was up and running in a matter of minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Llewellyn-Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: have 3 floor house over 3000 sq ft, replaced my 3 AirPort Extremes for the 3 unit Orbi. after trial and error, found that wifi is faster or better than if I connected the satellites via ethernet. I have 200mbps Broadband speed and virtually get this in every floor and room. Huge difference now as Apple routers obsolete and not designed for fast broadband speeds. Worth buying. already have 21 devices connected!
customer_reviews.author: Greek Evangelist

customer_reviews.title: Nice mesh system
customer_reviews.text: The Orbi system was easy to setup and configure. The wireless signal is strong throughout the house. The first Orbi I ordered was faulty and the wifi kept dropping. Amazon refunded no problem. Second Orbi seems to be ok so far.
customer_reviews.author: S.J.Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Highly impressive kit.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed! I had an Apple system with 2 extenders on Virgin fibre. Has been reliable and got 100MBs in the same room as router but only going down to 2MBs in the home office at the other corner of the house, despite an extender. Set this up with he satellite in the office. Now getting 85-100 MBs throughout the house and the garden. Well worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: AKA

customer_reviews.title: Orbi exceeds my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I’d spent a fair amount of time researching Tri band Mesh systems and concluded that the Orbi system would suit my needs.It’s so easy to set up out the box and has provided fantastic coverage across my property with just 1 SSID.Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: I. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great once you set them up
customer_reviews.text: I can't buy enough of these. They're even a gorgeous 'modern/technological' part of the decor. They have fixed Wireless issues, they are simple and they come with an app. The only thing I wished was the setup would be less time consuming and less of a hassle. Make sure you Update these
customer_reviews.author: The Super Star

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid fast WiFi but limited customer support
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little setting up to get the best results, but rock solid WiFi and speeds when you do. Not much comes close to Orbi in the home mesh market atm. Only downside is a fairly limited support package from Netgear (only 3 months after purchase).
customer_reviews.author: Welsh Whirlwind

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It took 2 attempts to install this correctly but it was worth it. I now have full WiFi bars in all rooms of my 4 bed 2 storey house which was all I wanted. Speed is also very good, the same as my wired connection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Transformational
customer_reviews.text: The NETGEAR Orbi has been a revelation. We are now getting proper internet speeds across all our devices. Had previously been thinking of ditching Virgin Media, but the problem was the router, not the service. Only issue was getting Sky Q boxes to work, but once I set static IP addresses, they were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Orbi Ultra-Performance Whole Home Mesh WiFi System (RBK50) – Router with 1 Satellite Extender, Coverage up to 4,000 sq. ft., AC3000 (Up to 3Gbps)
product_meta.description:
Size Name:Mesh Wi-Fi | AC3000| Style Name:2 PackOrbi by NETGEAR is the simplest and smartest way to enjoy high-speed WiFi in every corner of your home. The Orbi WiFi System easily covers 4,000 square feet of your home with strong WiFi signals. Because Orbi uses Tri-Band WiFi, your Internet runs at max speeds no matter how many devices connect. Enjoy better WiFi. Everywhere.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Product is sourced and shipped from the European Economic Area (EEA). Product is genuine original from manufacturer authorized distributors.

BOX CONTAINS


 * 1 x Orbi router (RBR50)

 * 1 x Orbi satellite (RBS50)

 * 1 x 2 m Ethernet cable

 * 2 x 12 V/3.5 A power adapters

 * Quick start guide



See more
feature_bullets: Mesh WiFi Whole home mesh Wifi coverage of up to 5,000 sq ft (460 sq m) and 25+ devices; Mesh technology helps you stay connected as you roam around your home using a single network name; extend coverage up to 2,500 sq ft with additional satellites (sold separately)
Tri-band backhaul: A dedicated band between your Orbi router and satellite frees up the other two bands for maximum speed to your devices

Works with all internet providers: Replace your existing Wi-Fi router and extender (separate modem or gateway required); compatible with any internet provider including cable, satellite, fibre, DSL and more
Wired Ethernet port and fast wireless speed: 1 Gigabit Ethernet port and AC3000 Wi-Fi powers up to 3Gbps of streaming HD video, gaming or internet surfing and downloads

Parental controls: Pause device internet access, view site history usage, and filter websites for free; set online time limits, schedule device internet access and more on Circle Premium (1st month free trial)

Enhanced cyber threat protection: NETGEAR Armor (powered by BitDefender) is network wide anti virus, anti malware, fraud/phishing/ransomware security on an unlimited # of devices for a 30 day free trial

Safe, secure and loaded with enhanced technology: Designed with MU-MIMO, Smart Connect for one Wi-Fi name and beamforming technologies; supports WPA2 wireless security protocols; includes Guest Wi-Fi access, DoS, Firewall, VPN and more
Easy to set-up and manage: Set up Wi-Fi in minutes with the Orbi app, manage Wi-Fi settings, test and monitor speed
